sim¶

class sim.Current[source]¶

Represents a current

class sim.Field(num_n, num_i)[source]¶

Represents either an electric or magnetic field using a 2D Numpy array. The zeroth axis represents increments in time and the first axis represents increments in space.

Parameters:
  • num_n – The number of temporal indexes in the field
  • num_i – The number of spatial indexes in the field
export()[source]¶

Returns the Numpy array that contains the temporal (axis=0) and spatial values (axis=1) of the field.

Returns:A Numpy array
get_field()[source]¶

Gets the field at the current time index \(n\)

Returns:The field at time n
get_index(i)[source]¶

Gets the value of the field at the current time index \(n\) and at the \(i\) th spatial index. If the requested index is out of the field bounds, the returned value is zero.

Parameters:i – The spatial index of the field to access
Returns:The value of the field a the current time index \(n\) and spatial index \(i\)
get_time_index()[source]¶

Gets the current time index \(n\)

Returns:The current time index \(n\)
set_index(i, value)[source]¶

Sets the value of the field at the current time index \(n\) and at the \(i\) th spatial index.

Parameters:
  • i – The spatial index of the field to set
  • value – The value to set at time index \(n\) and spatial index \(i\)
set_time_index(n)[source]¶

Sets the current time index to \(n\)

Parameters:n – \(n\)
update_field(nfield)[source]¶

Iterates to the next temporal index and updates the field at that time to nfield. Raises a ValueError if the new field is not of the correct spatial length and a RuntimeError if the end of the temporal indicies has been reached.

Parameters:nfield – The new field to append of length num_i
class sim.Sim(vacuum_permittivity, infinity_permittivity, vacuum_permeability, delta_t, delta_z, num_n, num_i, current, susceptibility, initial_susceptibility)[source]¶

Represents a single simulation. Field is initialized to all zeros.

Parameters:
  • vacuum_permittivity – \(\epsilon_0\)
  • infinity_permittivity – \(\epsilon_\infty\)
  • vacuum_permeability – \(\mu_0\)
  • delta_t – \(\Delta t\)
  • delta_z – \(\Delta z\)
  • num_n – The number of time indexes
  • num_i – The number of spatial indexes
  • current – A current object
  • susceptibility – A susceptibility object
  • initial_susceptibility – The initial susceptability. Eventually will be included in the susceptibility object.
current()[source]¶

Calculates the current at time \(n\) using the current object. Currently not implemented, and will simply return zero.

Returns:Zero
get_delta_t()[source]¶

Gets \(\Delta t\)

Returns:\(\Delta t\)
get_delta_z()[source]¶

Gets \(\Delta z\)

Returns:\(\Delta z\)
get_infinity_permittivity()[source]¶

Gets \(\epsilon_\infty\)

Returns:\(\epsilon_\infty\)
get_num_i()[source]¶

Gets the number of spatial indicies.

Returns:The number of spatial indicies
get_num_n()[source]¶

Gets the number of temporal indicies.

Returns:The number of temporal indicies
get_vacuum_permeability()[source]¶

Gets \(\mu_0\)

Returns:\(\mu_0\)
get_vacuum_permittivity()[source]¶

Gets \(\epsilon_0\)

Returns:\(\epsilon_0\)
iterate_efield(pef, phf)[source]¶

Iterates the electric field according to \(E^{i,n+1}=\frac{\epsilon_\infty}{\epsilon_\infty+\chi_e^0}E^{i,n}+\frac{1}{\epsilon_\infty+\chi_e^0}\psi^n+\frac{1}{\epsilon_0\left[\epsilon_\infty+\chi_e^0\right]}\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta z}\left[H^{i+1/2,n+1/2}-H^{i-1/2,n+1/2}\right]-\frac{\Delta tI_f}{\epsilon_0\left[\epsilon_\infty+\chi_e^0\right]}\)

Parameters:
  • pef – The prior electric field array (located half a time index away at \(n-1\))
  • phf – The prior magnetic field array (located half a time index away at \(n-1/2\))
iterate_hfield(pef, phf)[source]¶

Iterates the magnetic field according to \(H^{i+1/2,n+1/2}=H^{i+1/2,n-1/2}-\frac{1}{\mu_0}\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta z}\left[E^{i+1,n}-E^{i,n}\right]\)

Parameters:
  • pef – The prior electric field array (located half a time index away at \(n-1/2\))
  • phf – The prior magnetic field array (located a whole time index away at \(n-1\))
psi()[source]¶

Calculates psi according to \(\psi^n=\sum^{n-1}_{m=0}E^{i,n-m}\Delta\chi_e^m\) at the current time \(n\) and position \(i\). Currently not implemented, and will simply return zero.

Returns:Zero
